actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit tax-free sales of diesel fuel for off-highway uses.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to prohibit the imposition of excise tax on the sale of diesel fuel to any purchaser (or purchaser for resale to a second purchaser) for any use not as a fuel in a diesel-powered highway vehicle or a diesel-powered train. (Although fuel sold for such off-highway uses is tax-exempt under current law, provisions of the Revenue Act of 1987 require purchasers to pay the tax and subsequently apply for a refund based on the nontaxable use.)

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit tax-free sales of diesel fuel for off-highway uses.
